data.title: LALO SCHIFRIN 1986
meta_keywords: lalo schifrin douglas payne film score jazz arrange compose piano discography
data.meta_description: Composer, pianist and conductor LALO SCHIFRIN has made significant contributions to a wide variety of 20th century creative music. Best known for his film and television music, Schifrin has also had historical impact in the jazz and classical worlds. This outline details over four decades of Schifrin's significant contribution to music.

THE NEON EMPIRE

Lalo Schifrin

prob. Hollywood, California: c. 1989

(titles unknown)

Note: (1) Originally broadcast on Showtime cable TV on December 4, 1989. 1991 Cable Ace Award winning score. (2) A promotional cassette tape of this score was issued with no label, catalog number or track listing. The tunes include two Schifrin cues and a number of jazz-oriented source pieces that are probably a mix of Schifrin originals and covers including "You Go To My Head," "Day In, Day Out," "My Handy Man," "Don't Sit Under The Apple Tree," "In The Mood").

Issues: None.

MOVIE MUSIC MAN: A PORTRAIT OF LALO SCHIFRIN

Live at the M.I.D.E.M. Festival; Cannes, France: January 23, 1990

Lalo Schifrin (p, arr, cond); Ray Brown (b); Grady Tate (d) with the Orchestre National de Lyon.

a. Mannix (Lalo Schifrin)

n. Daphnis And Chloé Suite No. 2 (Ravel)

o. Pacific 231 (Arthur Honneger) p. Bolero (Ravel)

Note: (1) Highlights of this performance, where Schifrin was appointed "Chevalier de l'Ordre des Arts et Lettres," one of the highest distinctions granted by France's Minister of Culture, are featured in the British documentary, MOVIE MUSIC MAN: A PORTRAIT OF LALO SCHIFRIN. In addition to clips from BULLITT, COOL HAND LUKE and THE FOX (all Warner Bros. films) and the opening credits to MISSION: IMPOSSIBLE (Paramount Pictures), Schifrin is also seen discussing the temporal relationship between film and music, his influences (Oliver Messiaen, Sergei Prokofiev and Alex North) in both London and Cannes. The one-hour documentary is narrated by Steve Race. (2) Special thanks to Chris Sheridan for providing the Radio France information for this listing.

Issues: a, b, e, f, g, i, j, k, n & p on Image ID9296RADVD [DVD].
